sub_title: Senior Software Engineer at Thermofisher Scientific
summary:
I am a software engineer who focuses on writing clean, efficient and well tested code for embedded systems using modern C++. In my 6+ years of experience, I have worked on challenging problem statements in diverse teams within the high tech industry. I moved to Eindhoven in 2015 as a Master student and live here with my partner.
In my free time, I enjoy prototyping small robots in Python, playing the piano, tennis, running and hiking.

projects.title: Vision based autonomous solar car
projects.description: The objective of this project was to build a vision based autonomously driving solar powered car that is capable of navigating a track and follow traffic signs. The vision algorithm was implemented using OpenCV and Python for RaspberryPi 3. PD motor controller was implemented using arduino.

contributors.headline: Senior Software Engineer at Thermofisher Scientific

projects.title: Electronic Design Automation - HLS for image convolution application
projects.description: High Level Synthesis of an image convolution application using Vivado HLS and Vivado. RTL simulation was also performed and pipelining and unroll optimizations performed on the design.

projects.title: GPU parallelization for a mock bit-coin mining application
projects.description:
This project was completed as a requirement for the course "Embedded Computer Architecture". The goal of this assignment was to port a mock bit-coin mining application to GPU and exploit the extreme parallelism in the given application.
The final implementation was done using CUDA C while OpenCL was also experimented with during design space exploration.

contributors.headline: Senior Software Engineer at Thermofisher Scientific
Software Engineer - Platform at Catawiki

projects.title: Internet of Things based smart parking spot
projects.description:
This project was completed as a requirement for the course on Internet of Things. A brief summary of the implementation is as follows:
Service Discovery and advertisement : Avahi mDNS
Vehicle/Parking Spot Client and Broker : Wakaama
Protocol : IPv4 - CoAP and UDP
Message Type : CON (recipient acknowledgment)
Data Format : JSON
Broker, vehicle and parking spot apps : Python
UI for Visualization and Vehicle App : Python-Tk

projects.title: Parallelization of the AES encryption algorithm
projects.description: The goal of this project is to optimize the Energy-Delay-Area-Product (EDAP) for the AES encryption algorithm using OpenMP and Sniper Sim.

contributors.headline: Senior Software Engineer at Thermofisher Scientific

projects.title: Wireless Sensor Network for In-Vehicle Applications
projects.description: The scope of this project is to develop an application specific topology and compare its performance with a conventional Star topology using Cooja as the network simulator. The proposed approach is a combination of tree and star topologies that uses an adaptive multihop strategy to meet the QoS requirements in situations where a conventional star implementation fails to deliver.

projects.title: Formal Specification and Validation of an Automated Railroad Crossing System
projects.description: In this project, an Automated Railroad Crossing is designed from a set of requirements, specified using the mCRL2 tool and validated formally using the modal mu calculus.

projects.title: Bachelor's thesis - Condition Monitoring and Fault Prediction in induction motors
projects.description:
Sensor data acquisition, Feature extraction & trend analysis for fault prediction in industrial induction motors.
Cost effective monitoring and proactive GSM based warning system to minimize downtime.

projects.title: Rubik's cube solver
projects.description:
- An autonomous solver that can mechanically solve a 3x3 Rubik’s cube.
- Designed and built the setup using three individual 2-DOF servo manipulators.
- The algorithm was implemented using OpenCV on the RaspberryPi.

projects.title: Master Thesis - FSLM analysis and implementation
projects.description:
Flexible Spin-Lock Model - a resource allocation protocol for multi-processor resource constrained real-time embedded systems.
This thesis provided an implementation of the protocol on a FPGA platform to serve as a proof of concept and for making further performance calculations. 
The thesis also resulted in a schedulability analysis for the FSLM with implementation overheads included. 
The findings were published in IECON 2017 (See publications)

contributors.headline: Senior Software Engineer at Thermofisher Scientific

projects.title: PLC software test automation framework
projects.description:
The primary objective of the internship assignment was to evaluate the feasibility for automating the existing testing process for Factory Acceptance Testing (FAT) of PLC software used for Baggage Handling Systems (BHS). The secondary (optional) objective of the assignment was to implement a Proof of Concept for the suggested test automation framework.
Both objectives were delivered in a span of 2 months.
Received a grade of 9.5/10 for the internship.

contributors.headline: Senior Software Engineer at Thermofisher Scientific

projects.title: Application development - Display ECU
projects.description:
- Embedded application developer for "Message Display" - a primary display Electronic Control Unit (ECU)
- Application source code in embedded C and HAL development
- Product deployed as primary display in CAT Motorgraders, Articulated Trucks, Wheel loaders and Pipe layers.

contributors.headline: Senior Software Engineer at Thermofisher Scientific

projects.title: Display ECU Test automation
projects.description:
-Spearheaded the project for automation of the HIL testing of Display ECUs.
-Complete framework built on Python.
-Onscreen data capture and validation implemented using customized OCR software.
-80% increase in quality and velocity of testing process resulting from the elimination of human
effort from the test bench.
-$21k estimated savings in cost.

projects.title: Data Link simulator for Hardware-In-Loop (HIL) simulations
projects.description: Research project in developing customized data link simulator with multiple protocol support (including CAN/J1939 public and proprietary protocols) for HIL simulations during development and testing of ECUs, implemented using Zero Message Queue (ZMQ) high performance asynchronous messaging library.
